    • Method Detail

      • readEvalDataset

        public static void readEvalDataset()

      • readSynonymQuestions

        public static void readSynonymQuestions(java.lang.String inputFile)
        This function reads in the file containing the input synonym question dataset. It reads every line 4 times, every time as if the line containded words of one of the possible part-of-speeches. This is needed, since some words can take more than one POS, and it will be decided later which POS is assigned to which question.

      • readSynonymQuestions

        public static void readSynonymQuestions(java.lang.String line,
                                        net.didion.jwnl.data.POS pos,
                                        java.util.HashSet<java.lang.String> allWordSet,
                                        java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> lemmaMap,
                                        java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String>>> allQuestionsWithAllAnswersMap)
                                 throws java.lang.Exception
        This function processes a line of the input synonym question dataset. The lemma of all the input words is determined. Then the information contained in the line is saved in the sets/maps given as parameters to this function.
        Parameters:
        line - the line
        pos - the assumed pos for the line
        allWordSet - the set, to which the all the words with part-of-speech==@param pos are saved
        lemmaMap - a map, that maps the original question words to their lemmas
        allQuestionsWithAllAnswersMap - a map, in which the question words are stored with all the possible answers
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • readWordPairSimilarities

        public static void readWordPairSimilarities(java.lang.String inputFile)
        This function reads in the file containing the input word pair similarity dataset. It reads every line 4 times, every time as if the line contained words of one of the possible part-of-speeches. This is needed, since some words can take more than one POS, and it will be decided later which POS is assigned to which word pair.

      • readWordPairSimilarities

        public static void readWordPairSimilarities(java.lang.String line,
                                            net.didion.jwnl.data.POS pos,
                                            java.util.HashSet<java.lang.String> allWordSet,
                                            java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> lemmaMap,
                                            java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String>>> allQuestionsWithAllAnswersMap,
                                            java.util.HashMap<ComparablePair<java.lang.String,java.lang.String>,java.lang.Double> allQuestionsWithCorrectScores)
                                     throws java.lang.Exception
        This function processes a line of the input word pair similarity dataset. The lemma of all the input words is determined. Then the information contained in the line is saved in the sets/maps given as parameters to this function.
        Parameters:
        line - the line to be processed
        pos - the assumed pos for the line
        allWordSet - the set, to which the all the words with part-of-speech==@param pos are saved
        lemmaMap - a map, that maps the original words to their lemmas
        allQuestionsWithAllAnswersMap - a map, in which the question words are stored with all the possible answers
        allQuestionsWithCorrectScores - a map, in which the word pairs are stored with their correct score
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
